text: I'm gonna show you how to make a really
cool eggless pancake savory that's a
fantastic appetizer from Spain really
unusual it's called a torta Lita and
it's from Andalusia I learned that in
Madrid at this restaurant
that's called Tam Burnett Toscana the
Tuscan tavern the first time I went
there this guy says don't even look at
the menu he says forget the rest of the
menu after I gone two or three times I
wanted to see the rest of the menu and
there was this torte Delita as luck
would have it a few months later I was
back in Andalusia and I had it a couple
of other places it's got some unusual
features of that one is that the base is
chickpea flour which you could buy in
Indian stores called Bay's on de sa n
health food stores even supermarkets
these days and if you can find a good
Spanish market it will be there too so
about 50% chickpea flour and 50% white
flour all-purpose flour a little tiny
bit of baking powder say half a teaspoon
mix that up salt and now water so mix
them together the two flours and the
salt and add the water kind of gradually
chickpea flour has a tendency to lump so
if you make a kind of pace that you can
use the whisk to still get some traction
on okay so now you have a nice smooth
batter and there should be quite thin
and properly to make this properly you
should make the batter an hour or two in
advance and let it sit this is the
texture you're looking for thin pancake
batter heavy cream kind of texture and
then parsley but you can use any herb
you want and I've used chives I've used
cilantro I've used thyme some onion you
could put garlic in here too you can use
red onion or scallion again chives are
really nice and chopped shrimp you don't
need much you can use dried shrimp which
are total
cool sort of get him from Filipino
stores chopped some shrimp but I have
again used bay scallops sea scallops
what else did I use skate was really
good cod anything chopped into small
pieces and this is going to make two
pancakes another thing that's really
nice is a fair amount of black pepper
that oil is now hot so it's smoking it's
too hot
even that out a little bit so everybody
gets some of the shrimp why it wants to
do that it all goes into the middle and
now this is about three minutes on the
first side three minutes on the second
side and then just the quick flip to
crisp up both sides a no-stick pan is
nice for this you see how it's got these
lovely crispy lacy edges you'll know
when it's turnable because the inside
the center will be quite firm it's an
omelet essentially but no eggs high heat
or more or less high heat and as I said
about three minutes per side so this is
just another of those fabulous examples
of the pancake a batter
sometimes thickened with eggs sometimes
not sometimes sweet sometimes savory
sometimes vegetarians sometimes with
meat or fish totally international dish
but this is this is my new favorite
pancake actually you could slide this
out onto a plate flip the plates and
then slide it back in or you can do this
that was three minutes on the first side
this is very nicely crisp so now two or
three minutes on that flip side 30
seconds we're done I thought there was a
little too much water in here because
I'm used to letting it wait but now I
think this is the nicest one I've made
it's poufy look at that beautiful
Christmas there the green parsley
peeking out the shrimp in there see how
easy it is to turn like I said the
bottom is never gonna look as good as
the top
nice it's the most beautiful thing I've
ever seen
we can eat this you can put garlic in
here a lot of cilantro is good cilantro
and parsley any fish you like one of the
great unknown dishes of Spain
